breakfast.name: Whole Wheat Toast with Avocado and Smoked Salmon
ingredients: A sprinkle of red pepper flakes
breakfast.preparation: Toast the bread. Mash avocado and spread on toast. Top with smoked salmon and red pepper flakes.
breakfast.nutritionalBenefits: Provides healthy fats, protein, and fiber, good for satiety and energy.
breakfast.healthNotes: A good start to the day with healthy fats and protein.

lunch.name: Italian Quinoa Salad with Grilled Chicken
lunch.preparation: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
lunch.nutritionalBenefits: Provides protein, complex carbohydrates, and healthy fats for sustained energy and muscle recovery.
lunch.healthNotes: A balanced and flavorful lunch option.

dinner.name: Spaghetti Squash with Turkey Meat Sauce (Dairy-Free)
dinner.preparation: Roast spaghetti squash cut side down at 400F for 40-50 minutes until tender. While squash roasts, brown ground turkey in a pan with onion and garlic. Drain excess fat. Add crushed tomatoes and Italian seasoning. Simmer for 15 minutes. Once squash is cooked, shred the flesh with a fork. Top with meat sauce and garnish with basil.
dinner.nutritionalBenefits: Provides fiber, protein, and vitamins. A lighter alternative to traditional pasta.
dinner.healthNotes: Uses spaghetti squash instead of pasta for a lower-carb option. Dairy-free to accommodate preferences.

snacks.name: Apple slices with almond butter
snacks.preparation: Slice the apple and spread almond butter on each slice.
snacks.nutritionalBenefits: Provides fiber, healthy fats, and protein for sustained energy.
snacks.healthNotes: A quick and easy snack to curb hunger.

nutritionalFocus.reason: Essential for muscle repair and growth, especially important for weight management and supporting an active lifestyle.
Promotes satiety, aids digestion, and helps regulate blood sugar levels, which is beneficial for weight loss and maintenance.
Important for hormone production, brain function, and overall health. Helps with satiety and absorption of fat-soluble vitamins.

weeklyHabitTips: Drink at least 8 glasses of water per day to stay hydrated and support metabolism.
Incorporate 30 minutes of physical activity into your daily routine, such as walking, jogging, or cycling.
Plan your meals in advance to avoid unhealthy impulse decisions.
